docs.snippet: The bodies are piling up in the Philippines as President Rodrigo Duterte goes after drug suspects. Readers there react to a Times report on the crackdown.

headline.print_headline: Filipinos Praise Antidrug Campaign: ‘We Are No Longer Scared’
headline.main: ‘If You Resist, You Get Hurt, or Die’: Filipinos Praise Duterte’s Antidrug Campaign

docs.abstract: Many Filipinos support Pres Rodrigo Duterte's brutal antidrug campaign, as evidenced by comments on New York Times's website and Facebook page saying killing of thousands of drug dealers and addicts by police has made them feel safer.

docs.snippet: By just about every metric, Amazon, Apple, Facebook, Google and Microsoft are getting larger, more entrenched in their own sectors, more powerful in new sectors and better protected from competition.

headline.print_headline: ‘Frightful 5’ to Dominate Digital Life a Long Time
headline.main: Tech’s ‘Frightful 5’ Will Dominate Digital Life for Foreseeable Future

docs.abstract: Farhad Manjoo State of the Art column says Amazon, Apple, Facebook, Google and Microsoft are 'Frightful 5' tech companies positioned to dominate digital landscape for long time; points out they are becoming bigger, more entrenched and better protected from competition.

docs.snippet: Virtual assistants from tech behemoths including Apple, Microsoft, Amazon and Google are graded on their abilities to actually be of assistance.

headline.print_headline: Putting Virtual Assistants to the Test
headline.main: Siri, Alexa and Other Virtual Assistants Put to the Test

docs.snippet: In order to be of use, assistants like Cortana and Siri need to know a lot about you. Reading the companies’ privacy statements can give you an idea of how much.

headline.print_headline: The Data Needs of Virtual Assistants
headline.main: Protecting Personal Information From Virtual Assistants

docs.abstract: Tech Tips Q&A on why Microsoft's digital assistant Cortana requires so much personal information.

headline.main: Google Artificial Intelligence Beats Expert at Go Game

docs.abstract: This week we celebrate the victory of Google’s computer AI with a simple strategy challenge.

docs.snippet: Google’s fast-loading format is the latest effort to solve the pervasive problem of web pages taking too long to display on smartphones.

headline.print_headline: Google Joins Race to Speed Up Mobile Delivery of Articles
headline.main: Google Joins Race to Speed Up Mobile Delivery of News Articles

docs.abstract: Google is introducing faster approach to delivering news articles on smartphones; Accelerated Mobile Pages will offer horizontal presentation of news items from several publishers as part of search results.
